Package dog.giraffe.threads

Class SingleThreadedExecutor

  • java.lang.Object
    • dog.giraffe.threads.SingleThreadedExecutor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Executor
    public class SingleThreadedExecutor
extends java.lang.Object
implements Executor
    An Executor with no threads of its own. The execution of submitted tasks requires the owner of the executor to lend some resources. The tasks are kept in a queue. The owner of the executor must periodically call runOne() to execute the task at the head of the queue. SingleThreadedExecutors are not thread-safe.

      void clear()
      Removes all of the tasks in the queue without executing them.
      void execute​(Block block)
      Adds a task to the tail of the queue.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns whether the task queue is empty.
      <T> T runJoin​(Context context, SingleThreadedJoin<T> join)
      Runs tasks while the join is not completed.
      void runOne()
      If the queue is not empty it will execute the task at the head of the queue.
      int threads()
      Returns the maximum number of tasks that can be executed in parallel.

        public <T> T runJoin​(Context context,
                     SingleThreadedJoin<T> join)
              throws java.lang.Throwable
        Runs tasks while the join is not completed. If the join is not completed and there are no more tasks to run it will raise an exception.
